none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on April 21, 2014 Description from Terminal Escape:
Thundering raw DBeat coming at your from the furthest recesses of cavernous life. No frills in the songs themselves, but the guitars rely on flange and manipulation instead of pure distortion and the vocals are hollow shouts - it's the inevitable result of noiz punk maniacs starting to devour (and recreate) '80s goth and post punk...of course, the result is simply that it's even more reminiscent of the past. They crushed it when we played with them in Gainesville. VERMIN
//3.bp.blogspot.com/-7LlR7Egy2hE/U1UpTGelELI/AAAAAAAAJ5U/lMqrbv4LC-4/s1600/vermin+cover.jpg //1.bp.blogspot.com/-qNHbcB4XSHI/U1UqT57xImI/AAAAAAAAJ5c/gGRd20zijyo/s1600/vermin+img+copy.jpg

seo.title: Vermin - Vermin demo 2013 - Terminal Escape
